alert.note: Alert for Oakland; Washtenaw; Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 10:50PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wayne, southern Oakland, southern Macomb and northeastern Washtenaw Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1049 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Detroit Zoo to near Novi to near South Lyon. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Warren, Southfield, Royal Oak and Detroit Zoo around 1055 PM EDT. Livonia around 1100 PM EDT. Grosse Pointe around 1115 PM EDT. Detroit and Dearborn around 1125 PM EDT. Downtown Detroit and Wyandotte around 1135 PM EDT. Belle Isle around 1140 PM EDT. Taylor, Romulus and Greenfield Village around 1145 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Franklin, Keego Harbor, Melvindale, Commerce, Utica, Harper Woods, Pleasant Ridge, Westland, Grosse Pointe Shores and Huntington Woods. People attending Freedom Hill Amphitheatre , Jimmy Johns Field , and Milford Memories Summer Festival should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
